Package Custom_CollectionsED.graphs.Graphs

Class Network<T>

java.lang.Object
Custom_CollectionsED.graphs.Graphs.Graph<T>
Custom_CollectionsED.graphs.Graphs.Network<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The data type to be stored in this data structure
All Implemented Interfaces:
GraphADT<T>, NetworkADT<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameNetwork
public class Network<T> extends Graph<T> implements NetworkADT<T>
This class is a representation of a network, implemented through the use of an adjacency matrix.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected double[][]
    adjMatrix
    The adjacency matrix which represents the connections and edge weights in-between vertices.

    • iteratorDFS

      public Iterator<T> iteratorDFS(T startVertex)
      Description copied from class: Graph
      Returns an iterator for a Depth-First Search (DFS) traversal starting from the specified vertex. The DFS algorithm explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking.
      Specified by:
      iteratorDFS in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      iteratorDFS in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the index of the starting vertex for DFS traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator that provides vertices in the order they are visited during DFS traversal

    • iteratorShortestPath

      public Iterator<T> iteratorShortestPath(T startVertex, T targetVertex)
      Returns an iterator for the shortest path between two vertices
      Specified by:
      iteratorShortestPath in interface GraphADT<T>
      Overrides:
      iteratorShortestPath in class Graph<T>
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex
      targetVertex - the ending vertex
      Returns:
      the iterator for the shortest path

    • iteratorShortestPathIndices

      public Iterator<Integer> iteratorShortestPathIndices(int startIndex, int targetIndex)
      Returns an iterator for the indices of the shortest path between the specified start and target vertices. Uses Dijkstra's algorithm for finding the shortest path.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - the index of the starting vertex
      targetIndex - the index of the target vertex
      Returns:
      an iterator that provides indices in the order of the shortest path

    • getIndexOfAdjVertexWithWeightOf

      protected int getIndexOfAdjVertexWithWeightOf(boolean[] visited, double[] pathWeight, double weight)
      Finds and returns the index of an adjacent vertex with a specific weight in the graph. The weight is specified by the parameter 'weight', and the search is restricted to vertices that have not been visited and have a path weight equal to the specified weight.
      Parameters:
      visited - an array indicating whether each vertex has been visited
      pathWeight - an array containing the path weights for each vertex
      weight - the specific weight to find in the adjacency matrix
      Returns:
      the index of an adjacent vertex with the specified weight, or -1 if not found

    • mstNetwork

      public Network<T> mstNetwork() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Computes and returns the Minimum Spanning Tree (MST) of the network using Prim's algorithm. The MST is represented as a new Network instance.
      Returns:
      a new Network instance representing the Minimum Spanning Tree (MST) of the original network
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the original network is empty

    • shortestPathWeight

      public double shortestPathWeight(T vertex1, T vertex2)

      Parameters:
